perturbation.original_text: 13.4 Arbitration. If the Parties fail to resolve a Dispute by mediation under Section 13.3 and either Party desires to pursue resolution of the Dispute, the Dispute shall be submitted by either Party for resolution in arbitration pursuant to the then current CPR Rules for Non-Administered Arbitration of International Disputes (“CPR Rules”) (http://www.cpradr.org), except where they conflict with these provisions, in which case these provisions control. CPR is designated as the Neutral Organization for all purposes.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.15 Construction. If the Parties fail to resolve a Dispute by mediation under Section 13.3 and either Party desires to pursue resolution of the Dispute, the Dispute shall be submitted by either Party for resolution in arbitration pursuant to the then current CPR Rules for Non-Administered Arbitration of International Disputes (“CPR Rules”) (http://www.cpradr.org), except where they conflict with these provisions, in which case these provisions control. CPR is designated as the Neutral Organization for all purposes.
perturbation.explanation: Moves the mandatory arbitration clause to the 'Construction' section, where it is not logically related to dispute resolution. This makes it less likely to be noticed and more difficult to enforce, especially because construction generally applies to the interpretation of the contract, not the resolution of conflicts.

perturbation.original_text:
8.2.1 Materials. Upon the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement, Company shall immediately (a) cease, and cause the Sales Representatives and Other Company Employees to cease, all Promotion of the Product, (b) discontinue the use of any Promotional Materials, and (c) discontinue the use of any Janssen sales data, Target List and other documents and data related to the Product provided to Company by Janssen hereunder. As requested by Janssen, Company shall either maintain (subject to the provisions of Section 9.1 and Exhibit C) or promptly destroy (and certify to Janssen the destruction) or return to Janssen all Promotional Materials, all training materials and all other materials related to the Product provided by Janssen pursuant to this Agreement or the Brand Plan. With respect to any information, data, or reports provided by Janssen to Company under this Agreement, including Janssen sales data, that Janssen requests Company to destroy or return, Company shall upon the effective date of
termination or expiration of this Agreement remove such information from its internal systems and certify to Janssen to such removal; provided, however, that such information shall not be required to be removed from inactive back-up computer files created pursuant to standard, automated archiving procedures.
perturbation.changed_text:
14.13 Third Party Beneficiaries. Upon the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement, Company shall immediately (a) cease, and cause the Sales Representatives and Other Company Employees to cease, all Promotion of the Product, (b) discontinue the use of any Promotional Materials, and (c) discontinue the use of any Janssen sales data, Target List and other documents and data related to the Product provided to Company by Janssen hereunder. As requested by Janssen, Company shall either maintain (subject to the provisions of Section 9.1 and Exhibit C) or promptly destroy (and certify to Janssen the destruction) or return to Janssen all Promotional Materials, all training materials and all other materials related to the Product provided by Janssen pursuant to this Agreement or the Brand Plan. With respect to any information, data, or reports provided by Janssen to Company under this Agreement, including Janssen sales data, that Janssen requests Company to destroy or return, Company shall upon the effective date of
termination or expiration of this Agreement remove such information from its internal systems and certify to Janssen to such removal; provided, however, that such information shall not be required to be removed from inactive back-up computer files created pursuant to standard, automated archiving procedures.
perturbation.explanation: Relocates the required actions upon termination to a section about Third Party Beneficiaries. This is illogical and obscures the responsibilities of Company upon termination, making it difficult to enforce those requirements.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Authority. Janssen shall have sole decision-making authority with respect to all matters relating to the promotion and Detailing of the Product in the Territory under this Agreement (including making changes to the Brand Plan), but Janssen may not exercise such decision-making authority with respect to a change to the Brand Plan that would materially increase Company's Detailing obligations or materially increase Company's non-Detailing obligations.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.2 Force Majeure Event. Janssen shall have sole decision-making authority with respect to all matters relating to the promotion and Detailing of the Product in the Territory under this Agreement (including making changes to the Brand Plan), but Janssen may not exercise such decision-making authority with respect to a change to the Brand Plan that would materially increase Company's Detailing obligations or materially increase Company's non-Detailing obligations.
perturbation.explanation: The clause that originally outlines Janssen's authority is moved to Section 14.2 Force Majeure Event, thus creating a contradiction. The original section defines the decision-making authority of Janssen, including its limitations with respect to increasing Company's obligations. By relocating this clause to the section discussing events beyond control, it implies that Janssen's authority to change promotion and detailing is somehow related to or restricted by Force Majeure, creating confusion.
